pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā pilindavaccho rājagahe pabbhāraṃ sodhāpeti leṇaṃ kattukāmo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.2.eng: Venerable Pilindavaccha was clearing a slope near Rājagaha, intending to build a shelter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.3.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro yenāyasmā pilindavaccho tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ pilindavacchaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro āyasmantaṃ pilindavacchaṃ etadavoca—“kiṃ, bhante, thero kārāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.3.eng: Just then King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha went to Pilindavaccha, bowed, sat down, and said, “Venerable, what are you having made?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.4.eng: “I’m clearing a slope, great king. I want to build a shelter.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.7.pli: “Tena hi, bhante, bhagavantaṃ paṭipucchitvā mama āroceyyāthā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.7.eng: “Well then, sir, please ask the Buddha and tell me the outcome.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.8.pli: “Evaṃ, mahārājā”ti kho āyasmā pilindavaccho rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa paccassosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā pilindavaccho rājānaṃ māgadhaṃ seniyaṃ bimbisāraṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.9.eng: Pilindavaccha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened King Bimbisāra with a teaching,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.10.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro āyasmatā pilindavacchena dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito uṭṭhāyāsanā āyasmantaṃ pilindavacchaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.10.eng: after which the king got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated Pilindavaccha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.11.pli: Atha kho āyasmā pilindavaccho bhagavato santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.11.eng: Soon afterwards Pilindavaccha sent a message to the Buddha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.12.pli: “rājā, bhante, māgadho seniyo bimbisāro ārāmikaṃ dātukāmo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.12.eng: “Sir, King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha wishes to provide a monastery worker.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.13.pli: Kathaṃ nu kho, bhante, mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.14.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.14.eng: The Buddha then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.16.pli: Dutiyampi kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro yenāyasmā pilindavaccho tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ pilindavacchaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro āyasmantaṃ pilindavacchaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.16.eng: Once again King Bimbisāra went to Pilindavaccha, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.17.eng: “Sir, has the Buddha allowed monastery workers?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.19.eng: “Well then, I’ll provide you with a monastery worker.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.20.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro āyasmato pilindavacchassa ārāmikaṃ paṭissuṇitvā vissaritvā cirena satiṃ paṭilabhitvā aññataraṃ sabbatthakaṃ mahāmattaṃ āmantesi—“yo mayā, bhaṇe, ayyassa ārāmiko paṭissuto, dinno so ārāmiko”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.20.eng: But after making this promise, he forgot, and only remembered after a long time. He then addressed the official in charge of all practical affairs: “Listen, has the monastery worker I promised been provided?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.22.pli: “Kīvaciraṃ nu kho, bhaṇe, ito hi taṃ hotī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.22.eng: “How long has it been since we made that promise?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.23.pli: Atha kho so mahāmatto rattiyo gaṇetvā rājānaṃ māgadhaṃ seniyaṃ bimbisāraṃ etadavoca—“pañca, deva, rattisatānī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.23.eng: The official counted the days and said, “It’s been five hundred days.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.24.pli: “Tena hi, bhaṇe, ayyassa pañca ārāmikasatāni dehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.24.eng: “Well then, provide him with five hundred monastery workers.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.26.pli: kho so mahāmatto rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa paṭissuṇitvā āyasmato pilindavacchassa pañca ārāmikasatāni pādāsi, pāṭiyekko gāmo nivisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.26.eng: The official provided Pilindavaccha with those monastery workers and a separate village was established.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.27.pli: Ārāmikagāmakotipi naṃ āhaṃsu, pilindagāmakotipi naṃ āhaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.1.27.eng: They called it “The Monastery Workers’ Village” and “Pilinda Village”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā pilindavaccho tasmiṃ gāmake kulūpako hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.1.eng: And Pilindavaccha began associating with the families in that village.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā pilindavaccho pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaraṃ ādāya pilindagāmakaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.2.eng: After robing up one morning, he took his bowl and robe and went to Pilinda Village for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tasmiṃ gāmake ussavo hoti. Dārakā alaṅkatā mālākitā kīḷanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.3.eng: At that time they were holding a celebration in that village and the children were dressed up with ornaments and garlands.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā pilindavaccho pilindagāmake sapadānaṃ piṇḍāya caramāno yena aññatarassa ārāmikassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.4.eng: As Pilindavaccha was walking on continuous almsround, he came to the house of a certain monastery worker where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tassā ārāmikiniyā dhītā aññe dārake alaṅkate mālākite passitvā rodati—“mālaṃ me detha, alaṅkāraṃ me dethā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.5.eng: Just then the daughter of that house had seen the other children dressed up in ornaments and garlands. She cried, saying, “Give me a garland! Give me ornaments!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā pilindavaccho taṃ ārāmikiniṃ etadavoca—“kissāyaṃ dārikā rodatī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.6.eng: Pilindavaccha asked her mother why the girl was crying.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.7.pli: “Ayaṃ, bhante, dārikā aññe dārake alaṅkate mālākite passitvā rodati—‘mālaṃ me detha, alaṅkāraṃ me dethā’ti. Kuto amhākaṃ duggatānaṃ mālā kuto, alaṅkāro”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.7.eng: She told him, adding, “Poor people like us can’t afford garlands and ornaments.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.8.pli: Atha kho āyasmā pilindavaccho aññataraṃ tiṇaṇḍupakaṃ gahetvā taṃ ārāmikiniṃ etadavoca—“handimaṃ tiṇaṇḍupakaṃ tassā dārikāya sīse paṭimuñcā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.8.eng: Pilindavaccha took a pad of grass and said to the mother, “Here, place this on the girl’s head.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.9.pli: Atha kho sā ārāmikinī taṃ tiṇaṇḍupakaṃ gahetvā tassā dārikāya sīse paṭimuñci. Sā ahosi suvaṇṇamālā abhirūpā dassanīyā pāsādikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.9.eng: She did, and it turned into a beautiful golden garland.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.10.eng: Even the royal compound had nothing like it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.11.pli: Manussā rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa ārocesuṃ—“amukassa, deva, ārāmikassa ghare suvaṇṇamālā abhirūpā dassanīyā pāsādikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.11.eng: People told King Bimbisāra, “In the house of such-and-such a monastery worker there’s a beautiful golden garland.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.12.eng: Even in your court, sir, there’s nothing like it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.13.eng: So how did those poor people get it?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.15.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro taṃ ārāmikakulaṃ bandhāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.15.eng: King Bimbisāra had that family imprisoned.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.16.pli: Dutiyampi kho āyasmā pilindavaccho pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaraṃ ādāya pilindagāmakaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.16.eng: Once again Pilindavaccha robed up in the morning, took his bowl and robe, and went to Pilinda Village for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.17.pli: Pilindagāmake sapadānaṃ piṇḍāya caramāno yena tassa ārāmikassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paṭivissake pucchi—“kahaṃ imaṃ ārāmikakulaṃ gatan”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.17.eng: As he was walking on continuous almsround, he came to the house of that monastery worker. He then asked the neighbors what had happened to that family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.2.18.eng: “The king has jailed them, venerable, because of that golden garland.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā pilindavaccho yena rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.1.eng: Pilindavaccha then went to King Bimbisāra’s house and sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.2.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro yenāyasmā pilindavaccho tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ pilindavacchaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.2.eng: King Bimbisāra approached Pilindavaccha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho rājānaṃ māgadhaṃ seniyaṃ bimbisāraṃ āyasmā pilindavaccho etadavoca—“kissa, mahārāja, ārāmikakulaṃ bandhāpitan”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.3.eng: Pilindavaccha said, “Great king, why have you jailed the family of that monastery worker?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.4.pli: “Tassa, bhante, ārāmikassa ghare suvaṇṇamālā abhirūpā dassanīyā pāsādikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.4.eng: “Sir, in the house of that monastery worker there was a beautiful golden garland.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.5.eng: Even the royal compound has nothing like it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.6.eng: So how did those poor people get it?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.8.pli: Atha kho āyasmā pilindavaccho rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa pāsādaṃ suvaṇṇanti adhimucci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.8.eng: Pilindavaccha then focused his mind on turning King Bimbisāra’s stilt house into gold.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.9.eng: As a result, the whole house became gold.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.10.pli: “Idaṃ pana te, mahārāja, tāva bahuṃ suvaṇṇaṃ kuto”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.10.eng: He said, “Great king, how did you get so much gold?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.13.pli: Manussā—“ayyena kira pilindavacchena sarājikāya parisāya uttarimanussadhammaṃ iddhipāṭihāriyaṃ dassitan”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.13.eng: People said, “They say Venerable Pilindavaccha has performed a superhuman feat, a wonder of supernormal power, for the king and his court!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.14.pli: attamanā abhippasannā āyasmato pilindavacchassa pañca bhesajjāni abhihariṃsu, seyyathidaṃ—sappi navanītaṃ telaṃ madhu phāṇitaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.14.eng: Being delighted and gaining confidence in Pilindavaccha, they brought him the five tonics: ghee, butter, oil, honey, and syrup.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.15.pli: Pakatiyāpi ca āyasmā pilindavaccho lābhī hoti pañcannaṃ bhesajjānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.15.eng: Ordinarily, too, Pilindavaccha was getting the five tonics.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.16.eng: Since he was getting so much, he gave it away to his followers,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.17.eng: who ended up with an abundance of tonics.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.18.pli: Laddhaṃ laddhaṃ kolambepi ghaṭepi pūretvā paṭisāmeti, parissāvanānipi thavikāyopi pūretvā vātapānesu laggeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.18.eng: After filling up basins and waterpots and setting these aside, they filled their water filters and bags and hung these in the windows.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.19.pli: Tāni olīnavilīnāni tiṭṭhanti. Undūrehipi vihārā okiṇṇavikiṇṇā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.19.eng: But the tonics were dripping, and the dwellings became infested with rats.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.19.comm: Sp 1.621: Olīnavilīnānīti heṭṭhā ca ubhatopassesu ca gaḷitāni, “Olīnavilīnāni: dripping from below and from both sides.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.20.pli: Manussā vihāracārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā passitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.20.eng: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.21.pli: “antokoṭṭhāgārikā ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā, seyyathāpi rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.21.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are hoarding things indoors, just like King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.22.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.22.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.23.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.23.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.24.eng: “How can these monks choose to live with such abundance?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.25.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū te anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.25.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.26.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū evarūpāya bāhullāya cetentī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.26.eng: “Is it true, monks, that there are monks who live like this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.29.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā evarūpāya bāhullāya cetessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.29.eng: “How can those foolish men live like this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.31.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.31.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.32.1.pli: “Yāni kho pana tāni gilānānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭisāyanīyāni bhesajjāni, seyyathidaṃ— sappi navanītaṃ telaṃ madhu phāṇitaṃ, tāni paṭiggahetvā sattāhaparamaṃ sannidhikārakaṃ paribhuñjitabbāni.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.32.1.eng: ‘After being received, the tonics allowable for sick monks—that is, ghee, butter, oil, honey, and syrup—should be used from storage for at most seven days.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.32.1.comm: For the rendering of bhesajja as “tonic”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:1.3.33.eng: If one uses them longer than that, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.1.pli: Yāni kho pana tāni gilānānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭisāyanīyāni bhesajjānīti
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.1.eng: The tonics allowable for sick monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.3.pli: gosappi vā ajikāsappi vā mahiṃsasappi vā yesaṃ maṃsaṃ kappati tesaṃ sappi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.3.eng: ghee from cows, ghee from goats, ghee from buffaloes, or ghee from whatever animal whose meat is allowable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.7.eng: sesame oil, mustard oil, honey-tree oil, castor oil, oil from fat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.11.comm: “Syrup” renders phāṇita. I. B. Horner instead translates it as “molasses”, which doesn’t quite hit the mark. SED defines phāṇita as “the inspissated juice of the sugarcane or other plants”, in other words, “cane syrup”. According to the commentary at Sp 1.623 it can be either cooked or uncooked, the difference presumably whether it is raw or concentrated. “Syrup” seems closer to the mark than “molasses”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.12.eng: After being received, they should be used from storage for at most seven days:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.13.eng: they are to be used for seven days at a maximum.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.14.eng: If one uses them longer than that, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.15.eng: it becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn on the eighth day.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.15.comm: According to the commentary the counting of dawns includes the dawn on which the robe was received, see Bu NP 1:3.2.2. It seems reasonable to assume that the same method of counting should be employed in this rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.16.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.16.eng: The tonics should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.17.eng: “And, monks, they should be relinquished like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.18.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.19.pli: idaṃ me, bhante, bhesajjaṃ sattāhātikkantaṃ nissaggiyaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.19.eng: ‘Venerables, these tonics, which I have kept over seven days, are to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.20.eng: I relinquish them to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.23.eng: ‘I give these tonics back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.24.1.eng: If it is more than seven days and he perceives it as more, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.25.eng: If it is more than seven days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.26.eng: If it is more than seven days, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.27.eng: If they have not been determined, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.27.comm: In connection with the non-offense clause below, Sp 1.624 says the following: Anāpatti antosattāhaṁ adhiṭṭhetīti sattāhabbhantare sappiñca telañca vasañca muddhanitelaṁ vā abbhañjanaṁ vā madhuṁ arumakkhanaṁ phāṇitaṁ gharadhūpanaṁ adhiṭṭheti, anāpatti, “Anāpatti antosattāhaṁ adhiṭṭheti: there is no offense if, within seven days, one determines ghee, oil, or fat as oil for the head or as ointment; honey as ointment for wounds; and syrup as a scent in a dwelling.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.28.eng: If they have not been given away, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.29.eng: If they have not been lost, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.30.eng: If they have not been destroyed, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.31.eng: If they have not been burned, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.32.eng: If they have not been stolen, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.33.pli: Nissaṭṭhaṃ paṭilabhitvā na kāyikena paribhogena paribhuñjitabbaṃ, na ajjhoharitabbaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.33.eng: After the relinquished tonics have been returned, they are not to be used on the body, nor are they to be eaten.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.34.eng: They may be used in lamps or as a black coloring agent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.35.pli: aññena bhikkhunā kāyikena paribhogena paribhuñjitabbaṃ, na ajjhoharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.35.eng: Other monks may use them on the body, but they may not eat them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.36.eng: If it is less than seven days, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.37.eng: If it is less than seven days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.38.eng: If it is less than seven days and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.40.pli: antosattāhaṃ adhiṭṭheti, vissajjeti, nassati, vinassati, ḍayhati, acchinditvā gaṇhanti, vissāsaṃ gaṇhanti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.40.eng: if within seven days they have been determined, given away, lost, destroyed, burned, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.40.comm: “Taken on trust” refers to a situation where you have an agreement with a close friend that you may take their belongings on trust. The conditions for taking on trust are set out at Kd 8:19.1.5.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.41.pli: anupasampannassa cattena vantena muttena anapekkho datvā paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.41.eng: if, without any desire for them, he gives them up to a person who is not fully ordained, and he then obtains them again and then uses them;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.43.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np23:2.44.eng: The training rule on tonics, the third, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:0.5.eng: 24. The training rule on the rainy-season robe

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ vassikasāṭikā anuññātā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.2.eng: he allowed the rainy-season robe for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.3.eng: Knowing that this was the case, the monks from the group of six

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.4.eng: went looking for cloth for their rainy-season robes in advance.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.5.eng: And after sewing them in advance, they wore them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.6.eng: Then, because their rainy-season robes were worn out, they bathed naked in the rain.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū paṭikacceva vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesissanti, paṭikacceva katvā nivāsessanti, jiṇṇāya vassikasāṭikāya naggā kāyaṃ ovassāpessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.8.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six go looking for cloth for their rainy-season robes in advance, sew them in advance, and then wear them, and then, because their rainy-season robes are worn out, bathe naked in the rain?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.9.eng: After rebuking the monks from the group of six in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, paṭikacceva vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesatha?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe moghapurisā, paṭikacceva vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesissatha, paṭikacceva katvā nivāsessatha, jiṇṇāya vassikasāṭikāya naggā kāyaṃ ovassāpessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.15.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.17.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.17.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.18.1.pli: “‘Māso seso gimhānan’ti bhikkhunā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ; ‘addhamāso seso gimhānan’ti katvā nivāsetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.18.1.eng: ‘When there is a month left of summer, a monk may go looking for cloth for his rainy-season robe. When there is a half-month left, he may sew it and then wear it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.19.pli: ‘Orena ce māso seso gimhānan’ti vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyeseyya, ‘orenaddhamāso seso gimhānan’ti katvā nivāseyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.19.eng: If he goes looking for cloth for his rainy-season robe when there is more than a month left of summer, or if he sews it and then wears it when there is more than a half-month left, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.1.eng: When there is a month left of summer, a monk may go looking for cloth for his rainy-season robe:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.2.pli: Ye manussā pubbepi vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ denti te upasaṅkamitvā evamassu vacanīyā— “kālo vassikasāṭikāya, samayo vassikasāṭikāya, aññepi manussā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ dentī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.2.eng: after going to those people who previously, too, have given cloth for the rainy-season robes, he should say, “It’s time for the rainy-season robe,” “It’s the occasion for the rainy-season robe,” “Other people, too, are giving cloth for the rainy-season robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.3.pli: Na vattabbā— “detha me vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ, āharatha me vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ, parivattetha me vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ, cetāpetha me vassikasāṭikacīvaran”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.3.eng: He should not say, “Give me cloth for the rainy-season robe,” “Bring me cloth for the rainy-season robe,” “Trade me cloth for the rainy-season robe,” “Buy me cloth for the rainy-season robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.4.eng: When there is a half-month left, he may sew it and then wear it:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.5.eng: after sewing it during the last half-month of summer, he may wear it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.6.eng: When there is more than a month left of summer:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.7.pli: atirekamāse sese gimhāne vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesati, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.7.eng: if he goes looking for cloth for the rainy-season robe when there is more than a month left of summer, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.8.eng: When there is more than a half-month left:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.9.pli: atirekaddhamāse sese gimhāne katvā nivāseti, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.9.eng: if he wears it after sewing it when there is more than a half-month left of summer, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.10.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.10.eng: The rainy-season robe should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.11.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.12.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.13.pli: “idaṃ me, bhante, vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ atirekamāse sese gimhāne pariyiṭṭhaṃ atirekaddhamāse sese gimhāne katvā paridahitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.13.eng: ‘Venerables, this cloth for the rainy-season robe, which I went looking for when there was more than a month left of summer or which I wore after sewing it when there was more than a half-month left of summer, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.14.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.17.eng: ‘I give this cloth for the rainy-season robe back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.18.1.pli: Atirekamāse sese gimhāne atirekasaññī vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesati, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.18.1.eng: If there is more than a month left of summer, and he perceives it as more, and he goes looking for cloth for a rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.19.pli: Atirekamāse sese gimhāne vematiko vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesati, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.19.eng: If there is more than a month left of summer, but he is unsure of it, and he goes looking for cloth for a rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.20.pli: Atirekamāse sese gimhāne ūnakasaññī vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesati, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.20.eng: If there is more than a month left of summer, but he perceives it as less, and he goes looking for cloth for a rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.21.pli: Atirekaddhamāse sese gimhāne atirekasaññī katvā nivāseti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.21.eng: If there is more than a half-month left of summer, and he perceives it as more, and he wears the rainy-season robe after sewing it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.22.pli: Atirekaddhamāse sese gimhāne vematiko katvā nivāseti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.22.eng: If there is more than a half-month left of summer, but he is unsure of it, and he wears the rainy-season robe after sewing it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.23.pli: Atirekaddhamāse sese gimhāne ūnakasaññī katvā nivāseti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.23.eng: If there is more than a half-month left of summer, but he perceives it as less, and he wears the rainy-season robe after sewing it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.24.pli: Satiyā vassikasāṭikāya naggo kāyaṃ ovassāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.24.eng: If he has a rainy-season robe, but he bathes naked in the rain, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.25.pli: Ūnakamāse sese gimhāne atirekasaññī, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.25.eng: If there is less than a month left of summer, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.26.pli: Ūnakamāse sese gimhāne vematiko, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.26.eng: If there is less than a month left of summer, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.27.eng: If there is less than a month left of summer, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.28.pli: Ūnakaddhamāse sese gimhāne atirekasaññī, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.28.eng: If there is less than a half-month left of summer, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.29.pli: Ūnakaddhamāse sese gimhāne vematiko, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.29.eng: If there is less than a half-month left of summer, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.30.eng: If there is less than a half-month left of summer, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.32.eng: if he goes looking for cloth for the rainy-season robe when there is a month left of summer;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.33.eng: if he wears the rainy-season robe after sewing it when there is a half-month left of summer;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.34.eng: if he goes looking for cloth for the rainy-season robe when there is less than a month left of summer;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.35.eng: if he wears the rainy-season robe after sewing it when there is less than a half-month left of summer;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.36.eng: if, after looking for a rainy-season robe, he postpones the rainy-season residence;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.37.pli: nivatthāya vassikasāṭikāya vassaṃ ukkaḍḍhiyyati, dhovitvā nikkhipitabbaṃ; samaye nivāsetabbaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.37.eng: if, after wearing a rainy-season robe, he postpones the rainy-season residence (in which case he should wash it and store it and then use it at the right time);

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.38.eng: if his robe has been stolen;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.39.eng: if his robe has been lost;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.40.comm: “Emergency” renders āpadāsu. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.42.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.43.eng: The training rule on the rainy-season robe, the fourth, is finished.
